programme.title: La fille au bracelet
programme.desc: Teenaged Lise is put on trial for the murder of her best friend.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor and Joe Crowley prove there is more to Sherwood Forest than Robin Hood.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Beechgrove Garden is back and ready to guide you through a season of great growing.

programme.title: Landward (1/26)
programme.desc: As farming season gets under way, Dougie Vipond attends a ploughing competition in Fife.

programme.title: Easter from Kings
programme.desc: The traditional celebration of Easter with music and readings recorded in the candlelit Chapel of King's College, Cambridge, with the college's world-renowned choir under director Daniel Hyde. Members of the college will read from the King James Bible, and there is music from Bach, Mozart and Tchaikovsky. The service is led by the Dean, the Revd Dr Stephen Cherry.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: The best bits and favourite moments from Saturday Kitchen.

programme.title: Walking With... (Chocolate Special) S1 (20/20)
programme.desc: «Chocolate Special»The menu includes a surprise from Nigella Lawson - chocolate pasta.

programme.title: Parade de printemps
programme.desc: Fred Astaire stars as a despondent dancer who tries to make a chorus girl a star.

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Talking Pictures tells the story of the Hollywood musical, using interviews with stars from the genre's golden age, as well as some of the directors and songwriters who helped create them. Among those remembering their experiences are Fred Astaire, Gene Kelly, Julie Andrews, Rex Harrison, Barbra Streisand, Liza Minnelli and Judy Garland - and the films under discussion include classics such as Singin' in the Rain, On the Town, My Fair Lady, Funny Girl and The Sound of Music.

programme.title: La magie de l'oeuf (n°1)
programme.desc: From creation to hatching, David Attenborough reveals the wonder behind eggs.

programme.title: Flog It ! S11
programme.desc: Today, Flog It! comes from Normanby Hall in Lincolnshire, where hundreds of local people are welcomed with their family heirlooms. Our experts find the most interesting items to take off to auction, while Paul Martin learns how the stately home was turned into a hospital for forces during World War I.

programme.title: Mission déco S4 (5/8)
programme.desc: The five remaining designers redecorate 1930s beachside chalets in Eastbourne.

programme.title: Course sans frontières S3
programme.desc: The teams head for the third checkpoint, the Rocky Mountain resort town of Banff.

programme.title: Inside the Factory (Jaffa Cakes)
programme.desc: «Jaffa Cakes»Gregg visits a factory that churns out 1.4 billion Jaffa Cakes a year.

programme.title: The Boleyns: A Scandalous Family (Desire) S1 (2/3)
programme.desc: «Desire»Anne has grown into a real beauty. She is dazzling, and the king is caught in the glare. Her family play the long game to catch a king.

programme.title: Commando: Britain's Ocean Warriors S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: The King and HM the Queen's other children holding vigil around the coffin of Her Majesty.

programme.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe (Greece) S2 (1/3)
programme.desc: «Greece»Sara Pascoe learns Greece's endangered jobs, including bell making and a whistle language.

programme.title: Eternal Beauty
programme.desc: Having long lived with mental illness, Jane encounters new sources of love and joy.

programme.title: Gods of Snooker S1 (1/3)
programme.desc: Alex Higgins upsets the snooker establishment but turns the game into box office gold.
